description: Interactive agent for building, visualizing, and simulating genetic regulatory networks. It is designed around the concept of a developmental network model, and is intended to deal with large scale models with consistency and clarity. It is capable of representing systems that exhibit increasing complexity over time.
name: BioTapestry

metadata.abstract: BioTapestry is an open source, freely available software agent that has been developed to handle the-challenges of modeling genetic regulatory networks (GRNs). Using BioTapestry, a researcher can-construct a network model and use it to visualize and understand the dynamic behavior of a complex, spatially and temporally distributed GRN. Here we provide a step-by-step example of a way to use BioTapestry to build a GRN model and discuss some common issues that can arise during this process. metadata.title: BioTapestry: A agent to visualize the dynamic properties of gene regulatory networks
